definition: god of longevity/elderly person whose birthday is being celebrated
child whose birthday is being celebrated/birthday boy/birthday girl

sentences.english: Longevity here both sides of this gate.
sentences.chinese: 在說這大門兩側的福星和壽星。

sentences.english: This is an annual meeting of all the Sarpedons in town.
sentences.chinese: 這城中的老壽星們一年聚會一次。

sentences.english: Even trees live longer than people, and the Earth itself is far older.
sentences.chinese: 連樹也活得比人長，而地球本身就更是個老壽星了。

sentences.english: The birthday person shouldn’t have to cut the cake.
Birthday boy Nemanja Vidic is hoping for the perfect present when United meet CSKA Moscow in Russia tonight.
sentences.chinese: 壽星佬維迪奇希望能在莫斯科收穫完美禮物。

sentences.english: So it is the longest-living of all bird species. For centuries, cranes have been revered in China as symbols of longevity.
sentences.chinese: 丹頂鶴的壽命有六十年，它是鳥類中的壽星。

sentences.english: Shouxing refers to the Antarctic elderly.
I bought a roly? poly of the God of Longevity at that stall.
sentences.chinese: 我在那個攤頭買了個壽星不倒翁。

sentences.english: Confucius lived 72 to 73 years, a rare god of longevity indeed.
sentences.chinese: 孔子活了72到73歲，少有的壽星。

sentences.english: Old Shouxing, are the main Chinese myths and legends of a God of longevity.
sentences.chinese: 老壽星，是中國神話傳說中主長壽的一位尊神。

sentences.english: Educate students from the know-how of old life star aggressive toughen body.
sentences.chinese: 從老壽星的密訣教育學生積極鍛鍊身體。

definition: to offer birthday congratulations (to an elderly person)
senior female fellow student or apprentice/daughter (older than oneself) of one's teacher
to give a dinner party/to entertain guests/to invite to dinner
to announce good news/to report success
